title: Senior Business Analyst and Project Manager - Salesforce
description:
Your role



Are you ready to take your career to the next level with global exposure? Join our digital transformation journey and help shape the future of sales and product quality mgmt. at ITBA. In this high-impact role, you’ll lead strategic Salesforce initiatives and drive real business value across divisions.


As a Senior Business Analyst & Project Manager, you will:

* Lead and manage global Salesforce CRM and QCM (product quality mgmt.) projects
* Translate business needs into effective CRM/QCM solutions
* Collaborate with stakeholders across functions and cultures
* Drive process improvements in sales and product quality
* Facilitate workshops, define user journeys, and manage backlogs
* Work closely with agile teams to deliver value quickly


You will report to the Product Manager – CRM/QCM and work closely with the Business Transformation & Change Manager, Product Owners, and development teams.


To succeed, you will need


* 5+ years as a Business Analyst (Salesforce experience preferred)
* 7+ years in Project Management
* Strong understanding of Salesforce CRM
* Experience with Agile/Scrum methodologies
* Skilled in writing user stories, process flows, and business requirements
* Proven ability to manage multiple projects and stakeholders
* Experience facilitating workshops, stakeholder interviews, and requirement-gathering sessions
* Familiarity with tools like Jira, Confluence, Trello, or MS Project
* Bonus: Experience with SAP, data migration, or system integration
* Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Information Technology, Computer Science, or a related field

**We’re looking for someone who is**

* Collaborative – a team player who builds strong networks
* Open-minded – adaptable, curious, and culturally aware
* Resourceful – proactive and solution-oriented with an analytical mindset
* Entrepreneurial – results-driven and persistent


In return, we offer



At Atlas Copco, we foster a friendly, inclusive culture built on respect, integrity, and innovation. You will have:

* A global role with high visibility and impact
* Opportunities for international collaboration and travel
* A chance to grow professionally and shape digital transformation
* Access to global career opportunities within the Atlas Copco Group


Job location



This role offers a hybrid working arrangement, allowing you to split your time between working remotely and being on-site at our premises in Prague, Nantes, Pune, Stockholm.


**Uniting curious minds**  

Behind every innovative solution, there are people working together to transform the future. With careers sparked by initiative and lifelong learning, we unite curious minds, and you could be one of them.
company_description: Atlas Copco transforms industrial ideas into business value since 1873. Headquartered in Sweden, we serve 180+ countries. Learn more: www.atlascopcogroup.com

title: IT-specialist Stockholm
description:
Försvarsmakten finns för att skydda Sverige. Vår profession och värdegrund präglas av viljan att stödja och hjälpa, både varandra och andra. I vår värdegrund arbetar vi efter ledorden: Öppenhet Resultat Ansvar. Det innebär bland annat att Försvarsmaktens medarbetare löser sina uppgifter tillsammans, vilket ställer stora krav på delaktighet, förtroende och trygghet. Inom Försvarsmakten drivs alla uppdrag med ett tydligt mål att leverera resultat i rätt tid och till förväntad kvalitet. Alla medarbetare tar ansvar genom att vara lojala, både mot varandra och mot uppdraget.


Hos oss har du stora möjligheter att bidra till nytta och samtidigt utvecklas inom ditt kunskaps- och intresseområde.


### **Huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter**


Du kommer vara specialist i ett team med ansvar inom privata moln samt anslutande system. Du kommer att driva utvecklingen av förändringar från design till implementation vilket gör våra miljöer mer effektiva. Du kommer att stödja med teknisk kravställning och uppföljning, både mot interna och externa parter. Du kommer även omsätta verksamhetens tekniska krav till lösningar med lämpliga tekniska val.


Tjänsten ingår i ett team där jobbet innebär att du inom teamet har stort ansvar, och där du förväntas vara självgående och lösningsorienterad för att teamet ska nå uppsatta mål.


### **Vad vi erbjuder dig**


Verksamheten erbjuder stor variation och komplexitet samt stora krav på IT-säkerhet vilket innebär goda utvecklingsmöjligheter och förutsättningar för intern karriär rörlighet. Våra anställda har ett flertal olika förmåner, bland annat:


* Kompetensutveckling utifrån ett verksamhetsbehov och dina karriärsmål
* Tre timmar träning i veckan på arbetstid och du kan få ersättning för träningskläder och startavgifter
* Bra balans mellan arbete och fritid med flexibel arbetstid samt 28-35 semesterdagar beroende på din ålder
* Lönetillägg vid föräldraledighet och VAB samt möjlighet att växla semesterdagar mot extra pensionsavsättning

### **Kvalifikationer**


* Universitets- eller högskoleutbildning inom IT, alternativt att du har motsvarande förvärvad erfarenhet/utbildning som Försvarsmakten bedömer som likvärdig
* Specialist inom något av följande områden:
	+ VMware Cloud Foundation
	+ SQL Server
	+ Windows Server
	+ Linux
	+ Storage
	+ Automation
		- Powershell
		- Ansible
* Du behöver behärska svenska och engelska väl, både i tal och skrift
* Svensk medborgare

### **Meriterande**


* Erfarenhet av miljöer med mycket höga säkerhetskrav
* Erfarenhet av komplexa IT-miljöer
* Erfarenhet av att jobba agilt
* B-körkort

### **Personliga egenskaper**


Som person behöver du vara nyfiken, lösningsorienterad, ha förmåga att arbeta som en del i en grupp men också arbeta självständigt. Du har stort intresse för teknik och gillar att lära dig mer inom ditt teknikområde. Du är positiv, ser lösningar och hittar möjligheter och struktur.


Du är trygg med att arbeta i en verksamhet i förändring och tillväxt och har ett högt säkerhetsmedvetande. Vår värdegrund och profession stämmer överens med dina värderingar.


Stor vikt kommer att läggas vid personlig lämplighet.


### **Övrigt**


Befattningen är tillsvidare och inleds med 6 månaders provanställning för dig som inte är anställd inom Försvarsmakten. Placeringsort är Stockholm, utan möjlighet till distans, tillträde snarast eller enligt överenskommelse. I den här rekryteringen kan du komma att genomföra kunskapstester i samband med urval eller intervjuer. Din ansökan skall innehålla CV samt ett personligt brev.


Välkommen med din ansökan senast 2025-08-17. För eventuella frågor om rekryteringsprocessen maila HR, stina.bengtsson@mil.se.
company_description: Försvarsmakten är en svensk statlig förvaltningsmyndighet som ansvarar för landets säkerhet.

title: Software Engineer
description:
**Description**  



  

What To Expect:  


As a Software Engineer with the information retrieval team at Meltwater you will be building petabyte-scale search and analytics systems using Elasticsearch running on AWS. Every day, we add 1.3B new documents into our search platform and process over 6B engagement activities to provide the most complete dataset possible. This data fuels our products with robust insights that span key areas that include media, social, influencer, sales, and consumer intelligence.  


In addition to working with large-scale distributed systems, you will also have the opportunity to work on cutting-edge vector search technologies and explore use cases powered by Large Language Models (LLMs). These initiatives enable semantic search capabilities, enhanced content understanding, and more intelligent data discovery experiences for our users.  

Our culture is based on a fundamental belief in people with a passion for learning new things and a desire to help those around you. We are strong believers in team autonomy, DevOps culture and continuous delivery. Meltwater development teams fully own and operate their subsystems and infrastructure and run on-call rotations.  


We run on AWS and are heavy users of AWS services, Elasticsearch, Cassandra, Terraform, Docker; with a sprinkling of other database and messaging technologies depending on the need.  


For this role, you will benefit by having some experience with search engines, big data analytics, infrastructure, systems engineering and distributed systems. Experience with vector search and applied use of Large Language Models (LLMs) is also a plus. In our team you will get an opportunity to explore and push the technologies we use to their limits. This sometimes requires low level modifications to open-source libraries, other times it involves combining two existing technologies in an innovative way.  


On the software side we're heavy on Java and Kotlin, with some Spring, RxJava and plenty of microservices thrown in. We use Python for data science, machine learning and linear optimization purposes. Long experience with Java or Python is however not a requirement, instead we prefer an engineer with a history of rapidly acquiring new skills.  

For this position we are looking for Software Engineers that want to further grow in an organization based on collaboration across team and country boundaries. With the massive production scale of our systems, small decisions you make may have a big impact on our product and our many customers. If you get excited when talking about distributed systems at scale, or innovating on new ways to gain insights from all the world's information then you will love working with us.  


What You'll Bring:  

* At least 3 years’ experience in software development and distributed systems
* Experience with cloud services, preferably AWS (EC2, S3, SQS)
* Experience with Java and/or Kotlin
* You are curious and take pleasure in learning new things
* You enjoy solving problems with others
* You can carry a conversation in English
* You are eligible to work in Sweden

  


Nice to have Skills and Experience:  

* Experience working with Elasticsearch
* Knowledge of vector databases and embedding models
* Experience of applying LLMs / Gen AI to use-cases

  


What We Offer:  

* Enjoy 25 days of annual paid time off plus an additional day off on your birthday!
* Gain exclusive access to Avanza, enhancing your financial opportunities and investment options
* Enjoy automatic enrollment into the comprehensive EuroAccident, ensuring seamless access to healthcare benefits and financial security.
* Complimentary CalmApp subscription for you and your loved ones, because mental wellness matters.
* Energetic work environment where we are remote friendly but expect you to come to the office once a week to work with your colleagues in person.
* Benefit from our family leave program, which grows with your tenure at Meltwater.
* Thrive within our inclusive community and seize ongoing professional development opportunities to elevate your career.

  


Where You'll Work: Brahegatan 10 7tr, 114 37 Stockholm, Sweden  


When You'll Join: September  


Our Story  

At Meltwater, we believe that when you have the right people in the right environment, great things happen.  


Our best-in-class technology empowers our 27,000 customers around  

the world to make better business decisions through data. But we can’t do that without our global team of developers, innovators, problem-solvers, and high-performers who embrace challenges and find new solutions for our customers.  


Our award-winning global culture drives everything we do and creates  

an environment where our employees can make an impact, learn every day, feel a sense of belonging, and celebrate each other’s successes along  

the way.  


We are innovators at the core who see the potential in people, ideas and technologies. Together, we challenge ourselves to go big, be bold, and build best-in-class solutions for our customers.  


We’re proud of our diverse team of 2,200+ employees in 50 locations across
  

25 countries around the world. No matter where you are, you’ll work with people who care about your success and get the support you need to unlock new heights in your career.  


We are Meltwater. Inspired by innovation, powered by people.  


Equal Employment Opportunity Statement  

Meltwater is an Equal Opportunity Employer and Prohibits Discrimination and Harassment of Any Kind: At Meltwater, we are dedicated to fostering an inclusive and diverse workplace where every employee feels valued, respected, and empowered. title: Salesforce Lead Architect
description:
Are you a visionary Salesforce expert looking to make a significant impact? Sandvik's Mining business area is seeking a talented Salesforce Lead Architect to join our dynamic team. If you’re passionate about driving innovation and excellence, we want to hear from you!
Why join us?
We’re committed to providing cutting-edge solutions that enhance productivity and safety in the mining industry. Our diverse and inclusive work environment fosters creativity and collaboration, allowing our employees to thrive and grow. Join us to be part of a global leader in mining technology and contribute to shaping the future of the industry.
About your job
In this role, you oversee the design and implementation of Salesforce applications, platform lifecycles and maintenance within Mining. You lead and drive the activities of Salesforce Application Architects and the Application Development team in providing effective, scalable and sustainable solutions; to understand their requirements and recommend the best solutions. Developing technical integration approaches, including data flow and architectural diagrams, and establishing best practices for solution architectures are important parts of your mission.
To ensure seamless integration and optimization of Salesforce applications, you collaborate with cross-functional teams in an agile environment. Your expertise drives the development of innovative solutions that enhance our customer experience and streamline our operations.
Included in your responsibilities:* Providing design recommendations, risk assessments, and mitigation plans – translating business requirements into functional solutions.
* Close stakeholder collaboration.
* Driving tasks necessary for the completion of project deliverables, mini-projects, lifecycle management activities and change requests.
* Recommend the selection and integration of data-related tools, frameworks, and applications required to expand our platform capabilities.
* Monitor developments within the industry, vendor community, and technology trends to consider in product roadmaps.
* Develop technical integration approaches and establish best practices solutions for architecture.


The location for this position is Stockholm, Sweden and we offer you a hybrid work solution.
Your profile
We’re looking for someone with proven experience as a Salesforce Solution Lead or a similar role, with extensive experience in Salesforce architecture and CRM solutions. You’re proficient in Salesforce platform, data systems, integration, and security. A background containing project management is required. Your knowledge is backed by a university degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, Engineering, or another relevant field. Acting in a truly global environment calls for excellent English skills.
You have great communication and interpersonal skills, the ability to lead and mentor a team of Salesforce developers, and strong problem-solving and analytical skills. Add an innovative mindset with a passion for continuous improvement and a collaborative approach to working effectively in a diverse team, and you’re the perfect fit for this role!
Our culture
At Sandvik, we’re tech driven, innovative and entrepreneurial. We believe that success is a team effort so we value diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive culture where people can be themselves and reach their full potential. So, we invest in supporting each other, learning together and celebrating our differences. Visit our stories hub, LinkedIn or Facebook to get to know us further.
Contact information
For further information about this position, please contact Riitta Pernu, IT Delivery Manager for Sales and Marketing, riitta.pernu@sandvik.com
We’ve already decided on which advertising channels and marketing campaigns we wish to use and respectfully decline any additional contact in that matter.
Union contacts – Sweden* Cecilia Mickelsson, Unionen, +46 (0)70-616 90 89
* Fredrik Andersson, Akademikerföreningen, +46 (0)70-266 78 50
* Olle Hansson, Ledarna, +46 (0)70-650 57 43


Recruitment Specialist: Tanja Benavides
At Sandvik, we value work-life balance and due to summer vacation, it may take a little bit longer until we reply in this process. Riita will be available for questions from August 8th.
How to apply
Send your application no later than August 17th, 2025. Click apply and include your resume and cover letter in English. Please note that we don’t accept applications by e-mail. Job ID: R0078572.
As we aim for a fair recruitment process, we utilize assessment tools to safeguard objectivity. When you apply for this job, you will therefore receive an invitation via email to a personality and logic ability test. Feedback comes immediately after the test has been completed and the selection process begins after the application deadline.
To learn more about our recruitment process, please visit our career site or contact HR Services at hrservices.sweden@sandvik.com.

title: IT Technician
description:
##### **Rollen hos oss**


Som IT Technician hos oss blir du en nyckelperson i vår hybrida IT-miljö – där robusta on-prem-lösningar möter framtidssäkrade molnplattformar. Du är en tekniskt nyfiken "doer" och trivs i teknikens kärna, där du får ta ansvar, lösa problem och bidra till en säker, tillgänglig och effektiv IT-infrastruktur. I rollen får du både vara den som dyker ner i detaljer och den som hjälper oss ta nästa strategiska kliv.

##### **Ansvarsomården**

* Säkerställa drift, underhåll och utveckling av vår IT-infrastruktur (on-prem och moln)
* Hantera och optimera virtuella miljöer (VMware, Hyper-V)
* Installera, konfigurera och uppgradera servrar och klienter (Windows/Linux)
* Arbeta med nätverkskonfiguration, felsökning och VPN-lösningar
* Felsöka hårdvara, mjukvara och hantera tekniska beroenden
* Dokumentera miljön och bidra till god kunskapsdelning
* Delta i IT-projekt, uppgraderingar och förbättringar inom säkerhet
* Samverka med IT-säkerhetsteamet och verksamheten i tekniska frågor

##### **Dina erfarenheter och egenskaper**

* 3–5 års erfarenhet av liknande teknisk roll inom IT-infrastruktur
* Eftergymnasial utbildning inom IT eller motsvarande erfarenhet
* Gedigen kunskap inom Microsoft- och Linuxbaserade system
* Erfarenhet av hypervisors och virtuella miljöer (t.ex. VMware, Hyper-V)
* Förståelse för nätverk, topologier och felsökning
* Van vid processdrivet arbete och dokumentation
* Flytande svenska och engelska – tyska är ett plus

**Lär känna oss**


På MilDef blir du en del av ett företag som värdesätter engagemang och tvärfunktionellt samarbete. Här får du möjlighet att utveckla nya färdigheter, bidra i olika projekt och göra verklig skillnad för vår verksamhets framgång.


För mer information, vänligen kontakta Linnéa Blixt, HR eller Elin Hovbrandt, HR.

**Rekryteringsprocess och viktig information**


Tjänsten är publicerad under sommaren, en period då många är på välförtjänt semester. Vi kommer därför att följa upp med mer information under andra halvan av augusti.


Vi genomför bakgrundskontroller och drogtester på alla våra framtida kollegor innan anställning. För denna rollen krävs svenskt medborgarskap.


Vi undanber oss vänligt men bestämt kontakt från rekryterare då vi hanterar denna rekryteringen med hjälp av interna resurser.


Vill du veta mer om oss? MilDef.com


#LI-LB1

title: Teamlead IT-drift & Infrastruktur MQ Marqet
description:
**Brinner du för teknik som bara ska fungera - och vill ta ansvar för att den faktiskt gör det? Har du koll på både nätverk och människor, och gillar att skapa struktur och stabilitet i det dagliga arbetet? Då är det här din nästa utmaning - sök rollen som Teamlead hos MQ Marqet!**

**Din roll**  

I rollen som Teamlead IT-drift & Infrastruktur är du ansvarig för att vår IT-miljö fungerar smidigt, stabilt och säkert - varje dag. Du leder det dagliga arbetet i supportteamet (3 personer) och ser till att IT-stödet till butiker och kontor håller hög kvalitet. Samtidigt är du själv djupt involverad i tekniken: nätverk, servrar, molntjänster och säkerhetslösningar.


Fokus ligger på att skapa struktur, tydliga processer och en support som fungerar konsekvent och förutsägbart - särskilt i butikernas vardag där kassasystem, nätverk och skrivare måste fungera utan avbrott.


Du arbetar nära verksamheten, driver förbättringar i det operativa och bidrar till att teamet får rätt förutsättningar att leverera bra service och stabil drift.


**Din profil**  

Du är en erfaren IT-tekniker med bredd inom drift, nätverk och infrastruktur, och du har god vana av att ta ansvar och leda andra i det dagliga arbetet. Du trivs i en roll där du får kombinera teknisk problemlösning med att skapa ordning, struktur och framåtdriv. Du kommunicerar tydligt och har lätt för att samarbeta - både inom teamet och mot övriga delar av verksamheten.


**För att lyckas i denna roll, bör du ha följande kvalifikationer:**

* Relevant eftergymnasial utbildning inom IT, eller motsvarande erfarenhet
* Gedigen erfarenhet av IT-drift i Windowsbaserade miljöer
* Djup kunskap inom nätverk (t.ex. VLAN, VPN, WAN/WLAN, DNS)
* God kännedom om virtualisering, lagring och servermiljöer (t.ex. VMware, HPE, Nimble SAN)
* Vana att arbeta med Microsoft 365, Azure och Intune
* Goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska

**Meriterande:**

* Erfarenhet av att leda eller koordinera ett team
* Erfarenhet från retail eller annan användarnära verksamhet
* Kunskap inom IT-säkerhet, backup och klienthantering


Vi på MQ Marqet ser fram emot att välkomna en ny medlem till vårt team som kan bidra med sin unika erfarenhet och perspektiv.


**Vad du blir en del av**  

Hos oss på MQ blir du en del av en dynamisk och inkluderande arbetsmiljö med korta beslutsvägar, där din röst är viktig och du får möjlighet att både utveckla och utvecklas. Om du vill vara en del av vår framgångsresa och bidra med stor passion för affären kan detta vara en spännande möjlighet för dig!


MQ Marqet består av 95 butiker i Sverige, från Kiruna i norr till Ystad i söder, med huvudkontor i Göteborg. På e-handeln finns vi i Sverige, Finland och Danmark. Dessutom säljs våra egna varumärken i ett flertal europeiska länder via Zalando. Genom våra engagerade medarbetare och ett fantastiskt sortiment bygger vi vår framgång tillsammans.


**Ansökan**  

Den här rekryteringsprocessen hanteras av Jefferson Wells för MQ Marqets räkning, vilket innebär att du kommer att bli anställd direkt av MQ Marqet. Vid frågor om tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta ansvariga rekryterare Mark Ferrer på mark.ferrer@jeffersonwells.se


Urval och intervjuer sker löpande. Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!
company_description: MQ Marqet är den personliga modekedjan. Vi inspirerar med ett kvalitativt och prisvärt mode noga utvalt för vår kundgrupp.Vi kan stil och delar gärna med oss av vår kunskap.

title: Sr Produktägare - System & Integration MQ Marqet
description:
**Är du en teknisk visionär som samtidigt gillar att ha händerna i systemen? Vill du driva utvecklingen av ett IT-landskap i förändring - och göra det i nära samspel med både affären och tekniken? Hos MQ Marqet får du en nyckelroll i ett skarpt team där du leder systemutvecklingen framåt. Sök nu och bli en nyckelspelare i vår IT-framtid!**

**Din roll**  

Som Senior Produktägare - System & Integration hos MQ Marqet har du det övergripande ansvaret för vår IT-systemportfölj. Du arbetar i skärningspunkten mellan affär och teknik, där du kartlägger behov, sätter strategisk riktning och driver utvecklingen av vårt IT-landskap. Du har ett ansvar för att de affärskritiska system du äger utvecklas i takt med verksamhetens behov - med särskilt fokus på smarta integrationer, teknisk samordning och framåtdriv i systemlandskapet.


Du ingår i ett team om tre personer, där ni tillsammans ansvarar för olika delar av vår systemmiljö. Som senior i gruppen leder du det gemensamma arbetet framåt - både taktiskt och operativt - och fungerar som en samlande kraft för teamets prioriteringar och utvecklingsinitiativ. Du samordnar insatser, stöttar kollegor, och har en nyckelroll i dialogen med affären och övriga IT-funktioner.


Det här är en roll för dig som vill växla mellan det strategiska och det praktiska. Du arbetar med roadmap, arkitektur och riktning - men tvekar inte att själv dyka in i ett ERP-system, granska orderparametrar eller följa ett integrationsflöde på djupet.

**Din profil**  

Vi söker dig som vill ta ett helhetsgrepp om ett IT-landskap i rörelse - och som trivs i en miljö där strategi möter teknik på riktigt. Du har en god förståelse för systemarkitektur, dataflöden och integrationsstrategier, och är samtidigt bekväm med att själv arbeta i systemen när det behövs.


Din bakgrund kan vara inom systemägarskap, IT-produktledning eller utveckling, men det viktigaste är att du har erfarenhet av att driva förändring i tekniska miljöer och översätta affärsbehov till konkreta lösningar.


Som person är du kommunikativ och samarbetsinriktad. Du arbetar strukturerat, gillar att ta initiativ och har lätt för att se både detaljer och helhet i komplexa sammanhang.


**För att lyckas i denna roll, bör du ha följande kvalifikationer:**

* Relevant eftergymnasial utbildning inom IT, eller motsvarande erfarenhet
* Erfarenhet av ERP-system, gärna Microsoft Dynamics/Business Central
* Förmåga att översätta affärsbehov till tekniska lösningar
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta nära verksamheten i utvecklings- eller förändringsprojekt
* Goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska

**Meriterande:**

* Kodningsvana eller förståelse för moderna utvecklingsmiljöer
* Erfarenhet av att leda eller samordna tekniska team eller systemägare
* Vana av att arbeta med budgetfrågor och externa leverantörer


Vi på MQ Marqet ser fram emot att välkomna en ny medlem till vårt team som kan bidra med sin unika erfarenhet och perspektiv.


**Vad du blir en del av**  

Hos oss på MQ blir du en del av en dynamisk och inkluderande arbetsmiljö med korta beslutsvägar, där din röst är viktig och du får möjlighet att både utveckla och utvecklas. Om du vill vara en del av vår framgångsresa och bidra med stor passion för affären kan detta vara en spännande möjlighet för dig!


MQ Marqet består av 95 butiker i Sverige, från Kiruna i norr till Ystad i söder, med huvudkontor i Göteborg. På e-handeln finns vi i Sverige, Finland och Danmark. Dessutom säljs våra egna varumärken i ett flertal europeiska länder via Zalando. Genom våra engagerade medarbetare och ett fantastiskt sortiment bygger vi vår framgång tillsammans.


**Ansökan**  

Den här rekryteringsprocessen hanteras av Jefferson Wells för MQ Marqets räkning, vilket innebär att du kommer att bli anställd direkt av MQ Marqet. Vid frågor om tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta ansvariga rekryterare Mark Ferrer på mark.ferrer@jeffersonwells.se


Urval och intervjuer sker löpande. Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!

title: IT Security & Risk Officer
description:
Transport is at the core of modern society. Imagine using your expertise to shape sustainable transport and infrastructure solutions for the future? If you seek to make a difference on a global scale, working with next-gen technologies and the sharpest collaborative teams, then we could be a perfect match.


We are at a pivotal moment where digitalization is key to our future success, presenting an exciting opportunity to make a significant impact.

  

In an environment of change, with exciting new technologies and evolving customer needs, Group Trucks Technology (GTT) continues to invest in digitalization supporting our strategy, strengthen our core engineering functions, and prepare us for future goals.

  

As part of this strategic transformation, we are seeking a proactive and insightful IT Security & Risk Officer for GTT Digital Operations to help drive our digital ambitions securely and effectively.

 **About us**

  

Our 100-person team across Gothenburg, Lyon, Greensboro, and Bangalore drives digital transformation for GTT, fostering collaboration, synergies, and effectiveness. We are responsible for managing the IT strategy, initiatives and budget, leading the alignment of strategy work including AI, data, and simulation. We foster innovation and performance, promoting an innovative culture while balancing technical, operational, and relational aspects of the business

 **What will you do?**

  

As IT Security and Risk Officer you will identify, assess, and mitigates information security risks within an organization. You play a crucial role in safeguarding an organization's information systems and data by establishing policies, monitoring compliance, and implementing risk management strategies.

**Who are you?**
----------------

 **Capability Building & Change Enablement**

  

* Lead the development and execution of enterprise security capability programs within GTT, ensuring the engagement and buy-in from senior management, aligning operations to security directives, policies and guidelines.

  

* Facilitate cross-functional forums (e.g., Security Workgroups with business representatives) to drive collaboration, knowledge-sharing and business-aligned requirements gathering to further strengthen and enable desired security behaviors.

  

* Support operational teams with vulnerability management processes and tools

 **Awareness & Culture Change**

  

* Design and deliver tailored awareness activities, supporting the strategic roadmap. Follow up on awareness KPI’s, such as phishing email results or training completion, and implement risk mitigation plans.

  

* Translate technical content into business-relevant messaging to engage non-technical stakeholders and drive behavior change

 **Cross-functional collaboration & representation**

  

* Represent GTT in forums connected to vulnerability and security awareness collaborating with Information Security Officers and BISO’s from other TD/BA’s and geographical regions.

  

* Data-driven communication & Insight development.

  

* Compile and interpret technical data to visualize security data, enhancing clarity and impact during executive and operational presentations.
**Who are you**
---------------


As an enthusiastic security expert with a solid track record, you’re eager to advance your career while working with amazing people around the world. You excel in communication, and lead through networks, and you embody the Volvo Group Values with integrity and trust. You help foster a positive work environment based on meaningful work, diversity, supportive colleagues and management, and a growth mindset.

 **To succeed in this role, we believe you have:**

  

* A degree in engineering, IT, or cybersecurity, or equivalent experience and several years of professional experience in Cyber Security, IT Security, or Information Security, preferably within Enterprise Information Security.

  

* Understanding and proven experience in Information Security best practices, process design, and implementation.

  

* Certifications in CISSP, CISM, CISA, CRISC, or similar are preferred

  

* Experience with relevant standards (e.g., ISO27001) and data protection regulations (e.g., GDPR) are a merit.

  

* Leadership experience and familiarity with the manufacturing industry is a plus.

  

* Proficiency in English, both verbal and written.
**What's in it for you?**
-------------------------


We offer a solid package of compensation and benefits, plus you will enjoy:


working global company taking the maximum advantage of the strength inherent to differences in knowledge, experience, age, gender, and nationality, among others


We offer a stimulating environment where you’ll work with committed colleagues, influence strategic decisions, and grow in your professional role. We encourage initiative, innovation, and continuous development—both professionally and personally.

 **The last date to submit your application is August 15th, 2025.**

  

We’d love to hear from you and don’t hesitate to call us if you have any question!

  

Magnus Nilsson, Director CDO Office via mail: magnus.a.nilsson@volvo.com

  

Kindly note that due to GDPR, we will not accept applications via mail. Please use our career site

  

We value your data privacy and therefore do not accept applications via mail.

 **Who we are and what we believe in**  

We are committed to shaping the future landscape of efficient, safe, and sustainable transport solutions. Fulfilling our mission creates countless career opportunities for talents across the group’s leading brands and entities.

  

Applying to this job offers you the opportunity to join **Volvo Group**. Every day, you will be working with some of the sharpest and most creative brains in our field to be able to leave our society in better shape for the next generation. We are passionate about what we do, and we thrive on teamwork. We are almost 100,000 people united around the world by a culture of care, inclusiveness, and empowerment.

 **Group Trucks Technology** are seeking talents to help design sustainable transportation solutions for the future. As part of our team, you’ll help us by engineering exciting next-gen technologies and contribute to projects that determine new, sustainable solutions. Bring your love of developing systems, working collaboratively, and your advanced skills to a place where you can make an impact. Join our design shift that leaves society in good shape for the next generation.
company_description: Every day, we work with some of the sharpest and most creative brains in our field to leave our society in better shape for the next generation.

We are committed to shaping the future landscape of efficient, safe, and sustainable transport solutions. Fulfilling our mission creates countless career opportunities for talents across the group’s leading brands and entities.

  

Applying to this job offers you the opportunity to join **Volvo Group**. Every day, you will be working with some of the sharpest and most creative brains in our field to be able to leave our society in better shape for the next generation. We are passionate about what we do, and we thrive on teamwork. We are almost 100,000 people united around the world by a culture of care, inclusiveness, and empowerment.

 **Group Digital & IT** is the hub for digital development within Volvo Group. Imagine yourself working with cutting-edge technologies in a global team, represented in more than 30 countries. title: Business Process Manager (Temporary)
description:
Transport is at the core of modern society. Imagine using your expertise to shape sustainable transport and infrastructure solutions for the future? If you seek to make a difference on a global scale, working with next-gen technologies and the sharpest collaborative teams, then we could be a perfect match.


Are you passionate about change management, improving processes and ways of working in an international and commercial environment, in a team of bright and highly motivated minds, where customer value and customer satisfaction are at the heart of everything we do?  

Would you like to make a difference and have a valuable contribution to the sales effectiveness and exciting ambitions of the world’s most desired truck brand?

  

Come join us at Volvo Trucks!

 **Who are we?**  

The Sales Process Management department within the Volvo Trucks European Regional Value Chain (RVC) is located in Gothenburg, Sweden. We are a global, multi-cultural team with responsibility for strengthening Volvo Trucks’ business, our customers’ business and enabling the premium customer experience by driving the continuous improvement of Volvo Trucks’ sales and CRM processes, sales solutions and sales competences.

  

We aim to help our Sales Areas, Markets and Dealers achieve optimum Customer Satisfaction, increase of Sales and Profitability and a leading Market position.  

We are collaborative, inclusive, pro-active, creative and open-minded with excellency and customer orientation in focus.

**Your responsibility and main tasks**  

Your responsibility will be to initiate, coordinate, take the lead on and drive the continuous improvement, development and implementation of Volvo Trucks’ Sales and CRM Processes, Systems, Competences, Customer Master Data and Customer Insights with the aim to improve the Sales Effectiveness of Volvo Trucks’ Sales Areas, Markets and Dealers.

  

This includes amongst others:

* Fulfill the Business Owner role and validate, drive and secure the business requirements when it comes to our Volvo Trucks Sales and CRM processes, systems, Customer Master Data and competences (trainings)
* Perform Quick Scans, Process Analyses and Gap Analyses to identify and recommend process improvements
* Initiate and lead projects to improve, develop and implement Volvo Trucks CRM and Sales process and systems and establish ways of working and business rules, that support Volvo Trucks’ business
* Support VT HQ, Regional Value Chains, Sales Areas and markets with the creation, optimization and effective management of the Customer Data and Customer Insights
* Initiate and lead Customer Data Management improvement activities and projects
* Perform Health Checks and organize and lead Value Stream Mapping workshops in order to assess the CRM and Sales maturity of markets and dealers and determine course of action for improvement
* Recommend/secure/promote the Volvo Trucks CRM and Sales Process and way of working
* Organize and lead the CRM Community meetings and participate in various other forums (incl. cross-BA) as Business Owner representing Volvo Trucks

You will have direct contact and will be working cross-functionally with the Volvo Trucks Sales Areas, Markets, Dealers and other Volvo Trucks and Volvo Group departments and the various external partners.  

As a Business Process Manager Sales & CRM, you will be part of the Sales Process Management Team in the Volvo Trucks European Regional Value Chain and report directly to the Director Sales Process Management.

 **Who are you?**  

To succeed in this position, we believe you need to have excellent analytical, coordinative and organizational skills and a proven track record in Business Process Development and Change Management, preferably in an international environment.  

You have a deep understanding of Sales and CRM processes, preferably in the automotive industry.  

You are curious, open-minded and creative in finding the optimum solution and approach.  

You have experience from Consultancy and Project Management, able to provide insights, propose course of action and lead cross-functional projects, working in a structured way with high level of integrity.  

You have a holistic view, but also able to zoom in on details and break-down strategic objectives into business requirements and actionable plans.  

You have experience and a solid understanding of (Customer) Master Data Management and how it’s applied.  

As you will work with several stakeholders on different levels in different parts of the Volvo Trucks and Volvo Group organization, we also believe it is important that you have excellent communication, collaboration and stakeholder management skills and that you are able to effectively inspire decision-makers and anchor ideas and proposals.

 **Other Qualifications:**

* Holds a university degree in Business or equivalent experience
* Formal training and/or proven track record in Business Process Analysis, Business Process Modelling, LEAN six sigma and Change Management (e.g. ADKAR)
* Project Management and coordinative experience (both Business as well as IT projects)
* Being a collaborative team player able to build strong long-term relations and contribute to a positive team spirit
* Fluent in English, spoken and written, preferably also proficient in Swedish
  

We value your data privacy and therefore do not accept applications via mail.

 **Who we are and what we believe in**  

We are committed to shaping the future landscape of efficient, safe, and sustainable transport solutions. Fulfilling our mission creates countless career opportunities for talents across the group’s leading brands and entities.

  

Applying to this job offers you the opportunity to join **Volvo Group**. Every day, you will be working with some of the sharpest and most creative brains in our field to be able to leave our society in better shape for the next generation. We are passionate about what we do, and we thrive on teamwork. We are almost 100,000 people united around the world by a culture of care, inclusiveness, and empowerment.

  

At **Volvo Trucks** you will be part of leading the way towards a sustainable transport industry. For nearly a century we have been innovating for people – to make life easier, better and safer. Driving progress is our promise to customers, to the industry and to society. At Volvo Trucks we share a curiosity to learn, we work with passion and we embrace change to stay ahead. Join us, together we move the world we want to live in.
company_description: Every day, we work with some of the sharpest and most creative brains in our field to leave our society in better shape for the next generation.

title: Senior Software Engineer
description:
Transport is at the core of modern society. Imagine using your expertise to shape sustainable transport and infrastructure solutions for the future? If you seek to make a difference on a global scale, working with next-gen technologies and the sharpest collaborative teams, then we could be a perfect match.

**What you will doSoftware Engineer – Full Stack .NET Developer**
-----------------------------------------------------------------


At Volvo Group Digital & IT, we have a clear ambition to enable value creation at scale for the Volvo Group. With a new product centric operating model and digital technologies, we will produce digital offerings that are profitable, scalable, and differentiated. With Volvo Group Digital & IT, you will be part of a global and diverse team of highly skilled professionals, who learn continuously and embrace change to stay ahead. We have a very important role to play in reaching the Volvo Group ambitions for 2030. Do you want to be part of our transformation journey towards becoming the digital capability of the Group? The time is now.

**This will be us - your colleagues within Digital Delivery**
-------------------------------------------------------------


Digital Delivery is a new function within Volvo Group Digital & IT. It has the ambition to identify and execute on new digital initiatives in tight collaboration with TD/BAs and Group Functions as well as modernize and transform our existing solutions into products and to secure agile ways of working across the whole Digital Delivery function.  

Together with our digital talents, we will work on solution design and deliveries to improve business performance and create value at scale for Volvo Group. Included in our mission is to drive an efficient Volvo Group Digital & IT interface and Portfolio Management for the TD/BAs and Group Functions.  

  

We collaborate with other parts of the organization, both in Volvo Group Digital & IT, with TD/BAs and Group Functions. We foster an environment where ideas, thoughts and opinions can be shared. We are team players with clear common ambitions, and we win together.

 **Your future team**


You will join the Uptime Backbone "Stable team," a skilled and collaborative group working in an Agile DevSecOps environment. The team develops and operates backend systems that process and enrich telematics data for monitoring Volvo Penta machines. This data is shared with both internal and external systems to support critical uptime services. You’ll collaborate closely not only with your teammates but also with stakeholders across IT and the business side of Volvo Penta.

**Who are you?**
----------------


You are passionate about engineering best practices, advocating for clean code, and automating routine tasks. Comfortable working in agile environments, embracing change and continuous improvement. Your transparent, committed, and reliable nature builds trust among colleagues and customers. You have a strong desire to learn and adapt to new technologies, thriving in a changing world. Possessing excellent design and problem-solving skills is second nature to you. Proficiency in English is a requirement, and you're used to or enthusiastic about working in an international environment. You have the ability to work in a changing environment and demonstrate a strong team spirit while being interested in understanding business processes.


Do you dream big? We do too, and we are excited to grow together. In this role, you will bring:

 **Essential Requirements:**

* Proven experience as a Senior .NET Core Developer with strong proficiency in C#
* Good knowledge of Microsoft Azure, including Azure Functions, Service Bus, Event Grid, Blob Storage, Cosmos DB, Key Vault, and App Insights
* Strong understanding of microservices architecture, REST APIs, and API Management
* Proficient in working with relational and NoSQL databases such as Azure SQL Server and Cosmos DB, with experience in data access patterns and Entity Framework Core
* Well-versed in design patterns, SOLID principles, and unit testing methodologies
* Hands-on experience with testing practices, demonstrating a commitment to writing high-quality, reliable, and maintainable code
* Comfortable working in Agile Scrum teams, actively participating in ceremonies and delivering incrementally
* Self-motivated and able to work independently as well as collaboratively within an international, cross-functional team

 **Nice to Have:**

* Experience in leading or mentoring development team members
* Familiarity with security and quality tools such as SonarQube, DAST, SAST, and SCA
* Understanding of telemetry and diagnostics data in distributed systems
* Interest in or experience with business process domains, especially in industrial or automotive sectors
* Exposure to multi-site or global development environments
* Experience with CI/CD tools, including Azure DevOps or GitHub Actions
* Knowledge of logging, monitoring, and diagnostics in cloud-native applications

 **Your Mission If You Accept It**


As a Senior .NET Core Developer on the Uptime Backbone team, you’ll build and scale Azure-based microservices that enable monitoring and diagnostics for Volvo Penta machines. You’ll work with high-volume telematics data—processing, enriching, and exposing it through secure APIs to support critical business decisions.

* Write clean, scalable, and testable code using .NET
* Design and implement business logic, APIs, and backend services
* Review, refactor, and continuously improve code quality
* Stay current with technology trends to minimize technical debt
* Collaborate with team members and global stakeholders to deliver reliable, maintainable solutions
**What’s in it for you?**
-------------------------

**We offer a solid package of compensation and benefits, plus you will enjoy:**

* Strong focus on work-life balance to support both personal and professional growth
* Engaging experience in an Agile, international DevSecOps environment
* Excellent opportunities for learning, growth, and long-term career development
* Possibility to work across global teams or in cross-functional roles
* Regular collaboration with Volvo Penta IT and business stakeholders
* Supportive and inclusive environment fostering collaboration on business-critical solutions
* Friendly, skilled colleagues who value teamwork, mutual respect, and continuous improvement
* Work alongside smart, motivated, and genuinely kind people who want you to succeed
* Contribute to impactful products with the freedom to bring your ideas and make a real difference
**Ready for the next move?**
----------------------------


If you are curious to explore how we put our words into actions, follow us on LinkedIn and volvogroup.com.

 **Have questions? Call us!**  

Contacts:  

Hiring Manager - Mukul Keshari, mukul.keshari@volvo.com  

  

***Please note: Don’t wait until the last date to submit your application, as interviews are conducted on an ongoing basis.***

  

We value your data privacy and therefore do not accept applications via mail.

 **Who we are and what we believe in**  

We are committed to shaping the future landscape of efficient, safe, and sustainable transport solutions. Fulfilling our mission creates countless career opportunities for talents across the group’s leading brands and entities.

  

Applying to this job offers you the opportunity to join **Volvo Group**. Every day, you will be working with some of the sharpest and most creative brains in our field to be able to leave our society in better shape for the next generation. We are passionate about what we do, and we thrive on teamwork. We are almost 100,000 people united around the world by a culture of care, inclusiveness, and empowerment.

 **Group Digital & IT** is the hub for digital development within Volvo Group. Imagine yourself working with cutting-edge technologies in a global team, represented in more than 30 countries. We are dedicated to leading the way of tomorrow’s transport solutions, guided by a strong customer mindset and high level of curiosity, both as individuals and as a team. Here, you will thrive in your career in an environment where your voice is heard and your ideas matter.

title: System Administrator and IT Support
description:
\*\*YOU MUST BE A CITIZEN OF THE EU OR EEA OR HAVE VALID WORK PERMIT TO WORK IN SWEDEN. 
 



  





  
 



**Job description** 
  
 



 Do you have a passion for gaming and IT operations? As a part of my3Twelve team, you will have an opportunity to be a System Administrator while helping with IT support for our clients to deliver experiences that meet the needs of customers. My3Twelve is seeking a proactive and skilled System Administrator with 2-3 years of experience in a corporate setting and who has a passion for gaming. The ideal candidate will be responsible for maintaining our IT infrastructure, ensuring system performance, and providing technical support to staff. 
 



  
 



**Key Responsibilities** 
  
 


* Monitor and maintain servers, networks, and computer systems
* Install, configure, and troubleshoot hardware and software
* Perform regular backups and disaster recovery operations
* Ensure security and privacy of networks and computer systems
* Implement and maintain system updates and patches
* Coordinating with multiple clients, balancing various tasks, and navigating competing expectations
* Collaborate with other IT team members to resolve issues and improve system performance
* Be front line for technical improvements, including desktop support and troubleshooting hardware and software issues
* Perform the IT-related tasks for the on and off-boarding process (PC build-out, dev kit setup, etc.)
* Develop and own a process for managing requests including how issues are tracked, status is communicated, and resolved
* Identify, advocate for, and implement changes for the IT helpdesk process workflows based on requirements
* Work on both tactical (day-to-day) and strategic (long-term) projects
* Learn and implement best practices from other IT pros across organizations
* Lead the effort to evaluate and recommend hardware for various disciplines
* Document IT procedures and system configurations



  
 



**Qualifications** 
  
 


* 2-3 years of experience as a System Administrator or similar role. Service-minded, positive, can-do attitude
* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field
* Strong knowledge of operating systems (Windows, Linux)
* Ability to work independently and as part of a team
* Experience with network administration and network security
* Experience with configuring Azure virtual machines
* Experience with ITIL process-based helpdesk system
* Experience with a ticketing system such as JIRA Service Desk, Autotask, Kaseya, or comparable helpdesk systems
* Experience with corporate environments: AAD, AD, Directory Services, ADO, SharePoint, etc.
* Extensive knowledge of client hardware for setup, optimization, and troubleshooting
* Knowledge of authentication issues and resolutions
* Knowledge about basic network issues and resolutions
* Knowledge of printing and common issues



  
 



**Highly Recommended** 
  
 


* IT Operations/Engineering experience with a Game Studio
* Experience writing code/scripts in C# or PowerShell
* Experience troubleshooting client related issues in a corporate environment and the restrictions that comes with said environment
* Certifications such as CompTIA Network+, CompTIA Security+, or Microsoft Certified: Azure Administrator Associate are a plus.



  
 



 Pay: 25 000,00kr - 50 000,00kr per month

title: IT-Administratör till AISAB
description:
Vill du vara med och driva digital utveckling inom prehospital vård i en samhällsviktig verksamhet som gör skillnad på riktigt? AISAB söker nu en engagerad och lösningsorienterad IT-administratör som vill bidra till att utveckla och effektivisera vår verksamhet!
   

  

 AISAB är ett spännande bolag med utvecklingsfokus där IT-frågor är en viktig del. Vi har vuxit snabbt under det senaste året genom flertalet verksamhetsövergångar och är idag 1 700 medarbetare.
   

  

**Om rollen**
 Som IT-administratör på AISAB får du en nyckelroll i att administrera och säkerställa ett välfungerande IT- och telekomstöd inom hela organisationen. Tjänsten rapporterar till IT-chefen och du får arbetsledning från IT-samordnaren.
   

  

 Du arbetar nära både interna och externa parter och ansvarar för att våra IT-tjänster, system och lösningar fungerar optimalt och utvecklas i takt med verksamhetens behov.
   

  

**Dina arbetsuppgifter**
 I din roll kommer du att administrera IT- och telefoni, hantera beställningar, säkerställa drift och underhåll av IT-tjänster, telefoni, infrastruktur och IT-arbetsplatser. Du kommer att lösa IT-relaterade problem i samarbete med leverantörer, säkerställa att IT- och telefonilösningar är kostnadseffektiva, säkra och av hög kvalitet. Fungera som kontaktperson för chefer, medarbetare, konsulter och leverantörer samt bidra till utvecklingen av digitala lösningar som möter verksamhetens behov.
   

  

**I Arbetsuppgifterna Ingår Exempelvis Att**
* Hantera IT- och telekomutrustning samt programvarulicenser enligt gällande avtal
* Inventera, registrera och följa upp utrustningens livscykel (inköp, användning, avveckling)
* Ge grundläggande användarstöd till medarbetare (till exempel konton, skrivare, konferensrum)
* Hantera terminaler, köer, mobilabonnemang och telefoniplattformar
* Hantera interna beställningar
* Skapa och avsluta användarkonton i IT-system enligt behörighetsrutiner
* Utföra fakturakontroll mot beställningar och avtal
* Hantera inköp, underhåll och avveckling av skrivare och AV-utrustning enligt avtal.
* Uppdatera dokumentation, register och interna rutiner
* Genomföra interna informationsinsatser och utbildningar inom digitala verktyg och IT användning


**Vem är du?**
 För att trivas lyckas i rollen är det viktigt att du har integritet och personlig mognad. Du är strukturerad och lösningsorienterad och har en hög grad av flexibilitet i ditt arbetssätt. Ambitionsnivån är hög och att ta initiativ och driva utveckling framåt är en naturlig del i ditt arbetssätt.
   

  

 Du trivs med att arbeta självständigt så väl som att samarbeta då din roll innebär många olika kontakter. Du är van och trivs med att arbeta serviceinriktat och verksamhetsnära. Stor vikt kommer läggas vid dina personliga egenskaper.
   

  

**Kvalifikationer**
 Vi söker dig som har eftergymnasial utbildning med IT-inriktning eller liknande område som arbetsgivaren bedömer som lämpligt. Du har erfarenhet av arbete inom IT och telefoni, god datorkunskap, goda kunskaper om Office 365, telekommunikation och, god problemlösningsförmåga samt förmåga att arbeta självständigt och serviceinriktat.
   

  

**Meriterande**
 Erfarenhet av liknande roll inom offentlig verksamhet
   

  

 B-körkort då det ingår resor i tjänsten inom region Stockholm
   

  

**Vi erbjuder**
 En utvecklande roll i en samhällsviktig verksamhet, möjlighet att påverka och utveckla digitala lösningar inom prehospital vård, trevliga kollegor och ett öppet arbetsklimat, kompetensutveckling och möjlighet att växa i rollen.
   

  

 En mångsidig och utvecklande roll med stor påverkan.
   

  

 Ett kompetent och stöttande team.
   

  

 Vi har kollektivavtal och med det följer kollektivavtalade försäkringar, tjänstepension och möjlighet till löneväxling. För att du ska kunna ta ansvar för din hälsa erbjuder vi friskvårdsbidrag samt subventionerad sjukvård i form av kostnadsfri öppensjukvård.
   

  

**Anställningens omfattning**
 Heltid 6 månader med möjlighet till förlängning
   

  

**Ansökan**
 Välkommen med din ansökan senast 31 juli. Urval sker löpande så vänta inte med din ansökan!
   

  

**Har du frågor?**
 Välkommen att kontakta Rasmus Lindlöf rasmus.lindlof@regionstockholm.se, eller Jani Sundqvist: jani.sundqvist@regionstockholm.se
   

  

 Facklig representant: sirpa.vehkapuro@regionstockholm.se

description:
We're looking for a highly capable
 **Senior Program Manager** 
 to lead a large-scale initiative focused on transforming warehouse operations. This position is based in
 **Stockholm** 
 and offered as a
 **long-term rolling contract** 
 , ideal for someone who enjoys navigating complexity, aligning cross-functional teams, and delivering impactful results.
 



  





**What You’ll Do** 




  




* Take full ownership of a strategic warehouse transformation program, steering it from planning through successful execution.
* Orchestrate IT and software development efforts across diverse teams within a wide-reaching product landscape.

 , especially where software development plays a central role.
